data.name: Jester's Cap
data.flavorText: Think yourself a comedian? Try on this hat, and you'll be throwing punchlines left and right.

data.name: Rogue's Hat
data.flavorText: Worn to keep cool in the desert, its magic properties make it popular amongst students.

data.name: Apprentice Circlet
data.flavorText: This circlet is adorned with magical jewels, making it very powerful...and expensive.

data.name: Prankster's Crown
data.flavorText: This hat happens to have its own personality, so make sure you wash your hair regularly!

data.name: E-nigma
data.flavorText: Question me this, question me that...how good will you look, wearing this hat?

data.name: Highlord's Crown
data.flavorText: An ancient ruler passed this crown down to his children, and now it's in your hands.

data.name: Hound's Helm
data.flavorText: The Hound's Helm only looks like a dog...in fact, it was actually made by dogs!

data.name: Winged Helm
data.flavorText: This Helm was found in the ruins of an ancient city, but mysteriously disappeared...

data.name: Mayhem's Guise
data.flavorText: Mayhem was a warlock that caused lots of trouble. He was so well known that he used to wear this hat to hide among the crowds.

data.name: Frozen Crown
data.flavorText: This crown belonged to the terrible Ice King but he gave it away when a witch turned him into a nice king.

data.name: Infernal Helm
data.flavorText: The feathers tickle a little bit but this hat sure seems to spook your opponents. Maybe it's because it's still alive!

data.name: Training Cap
data.flavorText: Keeps your head out of the sun and your hair dry during those tough training days.

data.name: Light Hat
data.flavorText: It fits so nicely, and doesn't give you a case of nasty wizarding hat hair.

data.name: Cloth Hat
data.flavorText: It's cloth. It's green. It's a green, cloth hat!

data.name: Heavy Hat
data.flavorText: Someone told you that this was a Platypus that was turned into a hat. You're not sure, but it does seem water-resistant.

data.name: Leather Hat
data.flavorText: Leather hats are all the rage these days, especially since Worly the Wonderful wears one.

data.name: Durofibre Hat
data.flavorText: In classic wizarding blue, you might think this hat old-fashioned, but the old wizards smile when you wear it.

data.name: Magi-thread Hat
data.flavorText: The Magi loved the sun most of all, they just didn't like it burning their heads. So they made this popular hat.

data.name: Pyrium Hat
data.flavorText: Made with Pyrium thread in a classic style. This hat is a good option just about everywhere!

data.name: Mithril Hat
data.flavorText: Some think that the mithril in this hat gives you psychic powers, but who knows? Maybe you, when you're wearing it.

data.name: Vitrium Hat
data.flavorText: Older wizards don't like how younger ones wear this hat backwards.

data.name: Culix Hat
data.flavorText: Worn by fans of Culix, the famous historian who wrote "101 wacky warlock wands" and "The Tales of Hapless Headless Heath".

data.name: Trialmaster's Circlet
data.flavorText: This ceremonial circlet is exceedingly rare and grants wisdom to those who wear it. Who would give it up?

data.name: Winterfest Hat
data.flavorText: The official hat worn by helpers at Winterfest!

data.name: Winter Hat
data.flavorText: It may look like just a winter hat, but it is actually a MAGICAL winter hat!

data.name: Fancy Tophat
data.flavorText: This stylish hat is intended to be worn at formal gatherings, but you can wear it anywhere you want.

data.name: Earmuffs
data.flavorText: Need to keep your ears warm, but your hair neat? Try these earmuffs on!

data.name: Parka Hood
data.flavorText: Mrrrrrf mmmrrrhhmhhh mhhhmhmhr!

data.name: Reindeer Antlers
data.flavorText: If you've ever needed to look like a reindeer, this is the hat for you!

data.name: Snowman Head
data.flavorText: A large snowman mask, and it's even made out of snow! Brrrr!

data.name: Dragon Helm
data.flavorText: Legend says that those who wear can hear the songs of dragons. Often its wearers can be heard singing to themselves.

data.name: Frost Saber Cap
data.flavorText: When they grow into adults, Frost Saber Cats choose a new form. This one chose to be a hat for some reason.

data.name: Firefly Hat
data.flavorText: A magical hat crafted by the magical creatures in Firefly Forest.

data.name: Dragon Tiara
data.flavorText: Some say that if the correct words are spoken, this tiara will spit flames. Be careful what you say while wearing it!

data.name: Dragon Spike Crown
data.flavorText: Formerly worn by Eustace Redhale "The King of Dragons" and the last ruler to ride one. It has the power of dragon's fire.

data.name: Duelist Helm
data.flavorText: The hat of one of the greatest wizards in the Academy.

data.name: Shiverchill Hat
data.flavorText: The Shiverchill Tribes wear this hat during important ceremonies like the "Welcome to Winter" and "Tobogganing Tuesdays".

data.name: Tinder Toque
data.flavorText: A celebratory hat worn by the people of Spire on feast days. You can store a lot of food in it if you're sneaky.

data.name: Captain's Hat
data.flavorText: The choice of pirate captains everywhere! It smells like the sea and comes with a cool-looking eye patch!

data.name: Bandana
data.flavorText: The favorite head gear of scurvy dogs because it's very absorbent and pirates love polka dots.

data.name: Skycap
data.flavorText: This is the hat worn by the Skyfolk - the small creatures who live in the clouds above the Academy.

data.name: Mira's Hood
data.flavorText: Mira's hood radiates a powerful energy...

data.name: Desert Hat
data.flavorText: A fashionable hat worn by initiates in the Oasis Institute of Natural Creatures (OINC).

data.name: Explorer Hat
data.flavorText: This hat is rumored to have been worn by Looter Dan, the Academy's greatest explorer.

data.name: Tinkerer Hat
data.flavorText: An old hat, probably worn by the people who built the ancient city.

data.name: Robot Mask
data.flavorText: You aren't a robot, but this hat sure makes you look like one!

data.name: TEK-Y4 Headphones
data.flavorText: These headphones are used to enhance the dancing skills of the TEK-Y4 dancing robots!

data.name: Pumpkinhead
data.flavorText: This actually smells like a pumpkin! Kind of sweaty, though.

data.name: Luminite Mask
data.flavorText: A plastic Luminite mask...pretty well-made, I think!

data.name: Specter Hood
data.flavorText: The hood of a creepy specter - a bit dingy, but that just makes it even creepier.

data.name: Franky Mask
data.flavorText: A plastic mask of Franky the Stein, the popular TV monster.

data.name: Skelly Mask
data.flavorText: A plastic mask of a skelly.

data.name: Wolfy Mask
data.flavorText: A plastic wolf mask... ooooo scary!

data.name: Climber's Toque
data.flavorText: A thick, durable knitted toque, perfect for braving the harsh mountain conditions.

data.name: Featherwing Helm
data.flavorText: A standard viking helmet, but with wings! Who cares if they don't make you fly, they're wings!

data.name: Frost Beard's Mug
data.flavorText: The helm of the great Frost Beard. Causes the wearer to grow a beard of ice.

data.name: Lady Yeti Mask
data.flavorText: A Yeti mask covered in makeup...

data.name: Male Yeti Mask
data.flavorText: A Yeti mask...so scary!

data.name: Red Helm
data.flavorText: This relic from a more technical age seems to be restored perfectly...it even has that new car smell!

data.name: Ghastly Hood
data.flavorText: A strange feeling overwhelms you when you put on this hood; it makes you feel...mysterious.

data.name: Draconyx Helm
data.flavorText: This helm was worn by the warrior wizards of legend - meant only for those who passed the toughest of tests.

data.name: Black Fang
data.flavorText: This helm is worn only by the greatest of Bounty Hunters. Its staring gaze strikes fear into the hearts of all who see it!

data.name: Hunter Hat
data.flavorText: The standard-issue hat of a Bounty Hunter. It is durable enough to wear in a storm and provides excellent visibility.

data.name: Bee Hat
data.flavorText: The hat from a bee costume. It smells faintly of flowers.

data.name: Candle Knight Helm
data.flavorText: The magical flame on this helmet can never be extinguished.

data.name: Big Hex Helmet
data.flavorText: A helmet crafted by Big Hex's creator, the Warden who studied in Skywatch.

data.name: Arctursus Hood
data.flavorText: If Arctursus ever found someone lost in the mountains, he would shed some ice fur and create this hood out of it to keep them warm.

data.name: Florafox Bonnet
data.flavorText: This bonnet was grown in a Warden's garden in Firefly Forest.

data.name: Diveodile Toque
data.flavorText: Townsfolk that live on the shore crafted this diving toque in honor of the sea guardian Diveodile.

data.name: Magmischief Helm
data.flavorText: This helmet was crafted out of cooled lava from Bonfire Spire.

data.name: Cactus Cranium
data.flavorText: Perfect for your prickly personality. Poke! Poke!! Poke!!!

data.name: Chicken Hood
data.flavorText: This hood is no yoke! It is said that it was once worn by the bravest of warriors!

data.name: Petal Helm
data.flavorText: It's a special springtime hat!

data.name: Snowflake Hairclip
data.flavorText: A snowflake fell from the skies and landed on your head. At least, that's what you can tell everyone.

data.name: Weather Helmet
data.flavorText: Whatever the weather, this hat's got you covered!

data.name: Dire Pirate Mask
data.flavorText: Great for adventure on the high seas!

data.name: Jelly Cap
data.flavorText: Ceremonial hat inspired by magical jellyfish.

data.name: Deep Diving Helmet
data.flavorText: It's so old that it won't help you breathe underwater anymore, but it's still sturdy.

data.name: Sea Sword Cap
data.flavorText: This sleek hat will make you look sharp as a shark's fin!

data.name: Admiral's Cappello
data.flavorText: This old hat belonged to the admiral who led the charge against the evil Order of Influence many years ago.

data.name: Shell Armor Helmet
data.flavorText: This sturdy helmet has been forged under the pressure of deep ocean water.

data.name: Mushroom Cap
data.flavorText: Wearing this will make you look like a fun girl or a fun guy!

data.name: Wood Knight Helm
data.flavorText: The brim of this helmet is made from a hard-to-find nut that grows deep within Firefly Forest.

data.name: Polar Knight Helm
data.flavorText: Helm forged from ice found at the top of Shiverchill Mountain.

data.name: Wing Guard Ushanka
data.flavorText: The Wing Guard patrolled the skies to protect the machinery of Skywatch from people trying to mess with the weather. That is, until the Puppet Master appeared.

data.name: Chef's Hat
data.flavorText: This surprisingly soft hat will keep you cool in the kitchen.

data.name: Goblin Mask
data.flavorText: This goofy goblin mask is a favorite costume among young wizards during Pumpkinfest.

data.name: Scarecrow Mask
data.flavorText: Don't be scared! Unless you're a crow, that is!

data.name: Mummy Mask
data.flavorText: This classic Pumpkinfest look is sure to spook your friends!

data.name: Fallen Leaf Mask
data.flavorText: Celebrate the fall colors, or just hide in a pile of leaves.

data.name: Helm of the Glaring Dragon
data.flavorText: The fierce gaze of dragons protects you.

data.name: Dragon Command Circlet
data.flavorText: Feel as commanding as a dragon, or just say you are a dragoncorn.

data.name: Ice Dragon Tooth Crown
data.flavorText: This rare crown is formed from ice dragon teeth, giving you extra combat power!

data.name: Tidus Armor Cap
data.flavorText: The ultimate cap for wavy hair, from Tidus, prince of the waves!

data.name: Chill Char Helmet
data.flavorText: The two heads of Chill & Char combined into one helmet. Now you can look both Cool and Hot at the same time!

data.name: Luma Helmet
data.flavorText: The radiance of the sun shines from your head with this helmet inspired by Luma and her love of the sun.

data.name: Eclipse Helmet
data.flavorText: This helm was made from scales that Eclipse shed a long time ago, and adorned with his moon symbol.

data.name: Sky Captain Cap
data.flavorText: Full steam ahead! Command the skies with this time tracking captain's cap.

data.name: Flowers and Sprockets
data.flavorText: Gear up with bright flowers and shiny brass fittings. Practical and pretty!

data.name: Blue Star Helm
data.flavorText: Bee Bah Boo! Go Team Blue!

data.name: Red Badge Helm
data.flavorText: Protect your head! Go Team Red!

data.name: Titan Conqueror Power Helm
data.flavorText: Crafted from repurposed Titan Shards. The Floatlings plant the Shards in the ground, and after sprinkling them with Astral magic, remove the Shadow Magic from them.

data.name: Nice Holiday Bow
data.flavorText: A festive holiday ribbon that is just for the fun of it.

data.name: Fancy Holiday Bow
data.flavorText: Show your holiday spirit with this amazing topper. It's 'knot' to be missed!

data.name: Deluxe Holiday Bow
data.flavorText: It's top quality! Bow to no one with this amazing rare holiday hat!

data.name: Fire Feather Headdress
data.flavorText: A ceremonial hat sewn with magic in every thread to ward away evil spirits.

data.name: Hungry Spirit Mask
data.flavorText: The spirit living in this mask is ALWAYS hungry. Don't worry though, it won't try to eat you.

data.name: Flora Tropica Headband
data.flavorText: This headband is very popular among the dancers of Bonfire Spire. They say that the decorative flowers can only be found at the peak of the volcano.

data.name: Apple
data.flavorText: Looks delicious!

data.name: Tin Can
data.flavorText: An old tin can. Probably contained some soup or maybe some vegetables.

data.name: Salad
data.flavorText: Looks delicious!

data.name: Croissant
data.flavorText: Looks delicious!

data.name: Tooth
data.flavorText: It looks like the tooth of some monster. I don't think this monster brushed his teeth too often!

data.name: Large Scale
data.flavorText: The scale of a large reptile, probably a dragon!

data.name: White Feather
data.flavorText: The feather of a white bird. I've heard that some people at the Academy collect feathers...

data.name: Fish Bone
data.flavorText: Fish bones? Gross! Why am I even carrying this around?!

data.name: Red Feather
data.flavorText: The feather of a red bird. I've heard that some people at the Academy collect feathers...

data.name: Green Feather
data.flavorText: The feather of a green bird. I've heard that some people at the Academy collect feathers...

data.name: Cake
data.flavorText: A cake? I guess monsters celebrate birthday's too...

data.name: Blue Feather
data.flavorText: The feather of a blue bird. I've heard that some people at the Academy collect feathers...

data.name: Gold Ring
data.flavorText: A gold ring! I wonder how much it's worth?

data.name: Silver Ring
data.flavorText: A silver ring! I wonder how much it's worth?

data.name: Old Sock
data.flavorText: Weird! You ever wonder where all your missing socks go?

data.name: Purple Feather
data.flavorText: The feather of a purple bird. I've heard that some people at the Academy collect feathers...

data.name: Carmine Floret
data.flavorText: These flowers tend to spread quickly and are a common sight in Firefly Forest.

data.name: Helio Floret
data.flavorText: These flowers are only found growing in trees, making them hard to reach.

data.name: Slate Floret
data.flavorText: The Slate Floret can only be found growing underneath the largest rocks, far away from the sunlight.

data.name: Ring of the Forest
data.flavorText: This ring is made from Forest Emeralds, which are hard to find in Firefly Forest.

data.name: Forest Emerald
data.flavorText: The forest emerald is a bright, glowing stone found only in Firefly Forest.

data.name: Chicken
data.flavorText: Looks delicious!

data.name: Seedling
data.flavorText: The Firefly Forest is full of roots, which can grow into all sorts of neat things!

data.name: Mandrake
data.flavorText: In the Firefly Forest, sometimes roots sprout life! The result - the magical Mandrake!

data.name: Pizza
data.flavorText: Looks delicious!

data.name: Lucky Coin
data.flavorText: I wonder whose coin this is...? It looks like it's rare...

data.name: Icy Floret
data.flavorText: Also called the Snow Flower, this plant thrives in the harsh cold of the mountains.

data.name: Glacier Diamond
data.flavorText: This gem looks so much like ice that students often pass it by without notice.

data.name: Ring of the Glacier
data.flavorText: This ring is made from Glacier Diamonds, which are hard to find in Shiverchill Mountains.

data.name: Chillymoth
data.flavorText: When frightened, a Chillymoth turns into ice and people often keep them as trinkets.

data.name: Mountain Star
data.flavorText: These mysterious gems are formed in the ice on moonlit nights, but never melt.

data.name: Frozen Object
data.flavorText: It looks like there's something frozen inside! I wonder what it is?

data.name: Fire Flower
data.flavorText: This flower's petals look like a dancing flame, but the flower is cool to the touch.

data.name: Volcanic Ruby
data.flavorText: A glowing gem that can be found only in the hottest of places.

data.name: Sunfire Pod
data.flavorText: Nobody really knows how a sunfire pod is created, or where it comes from.

data.name: Embershard
data.flavorText: Not actually a gem, but instead a piece of glass or metal that has been formed in a volcano.

data.name: Ring of the Volcano
data.flavorText: This ring is made with Volcanic Rubies, which are hard to find in Bonfire Spire.

data.name: Message in a Bottle
data.flavorText: Looks like someone left a message in a bottle...I wonder what it says...?

data.name: Shark Tooth
data.flavorText: This tooth is huge and sharp...it must have come from a shark.

data.name: Red Shell
data.flavorText: A red clam shell, found in clusters on sunny beaches.

data.name: Blue Shell
data.flavorText: A blue clam shell, found in clusters on sunny beaches.

data.name: White Shell
data.flavorText: A white clam shell, found in clusters on sunny beaches.

data.name: Confused Shark
data.flavorText: This little shark looks confused...better keep it in water for now.

data.name: Bag of Flour
data.flavorText: Flour used for baking.

data.name: Bag of Spices
data.flavorText: Spices used in cooking.

data.name: Gears
data.flavorText: These look like they were part of a machine. I wonder what it did?

data.name: Medallion
data.flavorText: Strange markings are found on this medallion.

data.name: Spare Parts
data.flavorText: Various metal pieces...maybe they're part of a puzzle?

data.name: Cloth Scrap
data.flavorText: It looks like this cloth was torn from some larger fabric.

data.name: Scrap Wood
data.flavorText: A piece of scrap wood, probably useful for building.

data.name: Scepter
data.flavorText: This metal rod looks a little shabby...

data.name: Wrench
data.flavorText: A little worn, but probably still works great.

data.name: Lightning Stone
data.flavorText: This stone is supposed to hold electricity...my hair is standing on end!

data.name: Doubloon
data.flavorText: It's a pirate coin! I wonder if it's worth anything...

data.name: Scroll of Paper
data.flavorText: A roll of paper, looks pretty important.

data.name: Spyglass
data.flavorText: This spyglass is in pretty good condition...someone took good care of it!

data.name: Seeds
data.flavorText: A bunch of little seeds...who knows what they will grow into.

data.name: Green Key
data.flavorText: A strange-looking key adorned with a green jewel.

data.name: Animal Tag
data.flavorText: It looks like a tag for animal tracking...

data.name: Scoog's Hat
data.flavorText: This must be Professor Scoog's hat...smells like dog food...

data.name: Moog's Evil Scheme
data.flavorText: This appears to be a novel outlining all of Moog's plan to capture the Dynos. It's very well-written.

data.name: Digging Equipment
data.flavorText: It looks like a machine for digging...but the batteries seem to have fallen out.

data.name: Dyno Egg
data.flavorText: It's a dyno egg! It looks like it's safe and intact.

data.name: Prize Ribbon
data.flavorText: Looks like a cheap prize ribbon for winning the Robolympics...I wonder what I can use it for?

data.name: Scrap of Paper
data.flavorText: Contains a lot of scribbles and doodles.

data.name: Monster Note
data.flavorText: It says - 'Huffy mop derp biggy book Flora'. Okay...

data.name: Broken Stone
data.flavorText: Looks like a piece of a bridge, covered in claw marks.

data.name: Broken Flute
data.flavorText: A wooden flute...looks like it was broken in half.

data.name: Magic Flute
data.flavorText: A wooden flute containing the magical powers of the forest.

data.name: Power Crystal
data.flavorText: Crystal used to power the old furnaces in the ice caves.

data.name: Miner Shovel
data.flavorText: A shovel...looks sturdy enough to dig through anything!

data.name: Spoon
data.flavorText: A very large, Yeti-sized spoon. Definitely not a shovel.

data.name: Crystal
data.flavorText: A dim, worn-out Power Crystal. It no longer possesses enough energy to be of any use.

data.name: Bok's Key
data.flavorText: A key to a chest containing Bok's shovel.

data.name: Firework
data.flavorText: Classic fireworks, great to use during a celebration.

data.name: Confetti
data.flavorText: What's a party without confetti?

data.name: Firefly
data.flavorText: A firefly from the Firefly Forest. Bring these to the merchant in the Firefly Clearing for rewards.

data.name: Frozen Something
data.flavorText: This ice block has something inside it. Maybe there's a way to get it out?

data.name: Ice Crystal
data.flavorText: A valuable ice crystal from the Shiverchill Mountains. Bring these to the miner in the Ruined Entrance for rewards.

data.name: Factory Key
data.flavorText: A key to the factory in Skywatch.

data.name: Master Key Fragment
data.flavorText: Half of the Master Key. Find both halves and bring them to Benni to fix.

data.name: Master Key
data.flavorText: The key to the Cumulus Room in the Skywatch Factory.

data.name: Bounty Note
data.flavorText: This bounty note means you have accepted the 1st bounty for today. Check the bounty section of the Awards Menu for details.

data.name: Bounty Note
data.flavorText: This bounty note means you have accepted the 2nd bounty for today. Check the bounty section of the Awards Menu for details.

data.name: Bounty Note
data.flavorText: This bounty note means you have accepted the 3rd bounty for today. Check the bounty section of the Awards Menu for details.

data.name: Weather O Meter
data.flavorText: Benni uses this device to take weather readings around Skywatch, but it looks like it's been chewed up.

data.name: Raisin
data.flavorText: Slurpy's special ingredient.

data.name: Cooking Tools
data.flavorText: A ragtag assortment of cooking tools.

data.name: Turnip
data.flavorText: This huge turnip is the Queen's favorite ingredient.

data.name: Slurpy's Dish
data.flavorText: A stew made from turnips by Slurpy the slime. It is surprisingly well made.

data.name: Crimson Ruby Key
data.flavorText: A key used to open a very special chest in Bonfire Spire.

data.name: Weather O Meter
data.flavorText: Benni uses this device to take weather readings around Skywatch, but it looks like it's been chewed up.

data.name: Scroll of Paper
data.flavorText: A roll of paper, looks pretty important.

data.name: Heroic Resist All
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you resistance to ALL attacks in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Fire Resist
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you resistance to Fire attacks in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Rare Fire Resist
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you strong resistance to Fire attacks in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Water Resist
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you resistance to Water attacks in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Rare Water Resist
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you strong resistance to Water attacks in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Earth Resist
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you resistance to Earth attacks in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Rare Earth Resist
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you strong resistance to Earth attacks in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Ice Resist
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you resistance to Ice attacks in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Rare Ice Resist
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you strong resistance to Ice attacks in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Storm Resist
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you resistance to Storm attacks in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Rare Storm Resist
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you strong resistance to Storm attacks in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Damage Bonus
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives a boost to your attack damage in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Rare Damage Bonus
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives a strong boost to your attack damage in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Critical Chance Up
data.effect: Bonus: Critical hits happen twice as often
data.flavorText: This battle potion increases the chance your attack will be a critical hit in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Heroic Always Critical
data.effect: Bonus: Attacks are always critical hits
data.flavorText: This battle potion makes every attack you use a critical hit in monster battles. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Rare Resist All
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you resistance to ALL attacks in monster battles except Shadow element. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Heroic Resist All
data.flavorText: This battle potion gives you resistance to ALL attacks in monster battles except Shadow element. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Goop Sample
data.flavorText: Mysterious goop. Eve may know more about it.

data.name: Tough Monster Scales
data.flavorText: Scales shed from a powerful beast. These strong scales are almost indestructible.

data.name: Captain's Quarters Key
data.flavorText: Unlocks the captain's door in Shipwreck Shore. An inscription on it says "Captain Windsail's Quarters".

data.name: Heroic Resist All (Sample)
data.flavorText: This free sample is a battle potion that gives you resistance to ALL attacks in monster battles except Shadow element. Lasts for 1 battle.

data.name: Shovel
data.flavorText: A shovel used for digging up fossils.

data.name: TEK-Y4
data.flavorText: A dancing robot with a neural network processor for dance move acceleration and increased groove accuracy.

data.name: Firefly Gem
data.flavorText: An emerald representing your mastery of Flora's trials in Firefly Forest.

data.name: Shiverchill Gem
data.flavorText: A diamond representing your aid in Bok's woes in the Shiverchill Mountains.

data.name: Bounty Note
data.flavorText: This bounty note means you have accepted the 1st bounty for today. Check the bounty section of the Awards Menu for details.

data.name: Bounty Note
data.flavorText: This bounty note means you have accepted the 2nd bounty for today. Check the bounty section of the Awards Menu for details.

data.name: Bounty Note
data.flavorText: This bounty note means you have accepted the 3rd bounty for today. Check the bounty section of the Awards Menu for details.

data.name: Vine Pruner
data.flavorText: A fiery wand that burns away those pesky vines.

data.name: Vinecinerator 2000
data.flavorText: Having trouble with vines that are too thick to burn with your Vine Pruner? Not to worry, here's the Vinecinerator 2000!

data.name: Skywatch Gem
data.flavorText: An amethyst representing your adventures during Eugene's pranks in Skywatch.

data.name: Bonfire Gem
data.flavorText: A ruby given to you by Slurpy after helping him in his quest to become a chef. This is the Warden Keystone of Bonfire Spire.

data.name: Boots of Hotwalk
data.flavorText: These boots allow the wearer to walk on lava.

data.name: Island Map
data.flavorText: A map of the entire island!

data.name: Breathing Bubble
data.flavorText: Allows wizards to breathe underwater.

data.name: Sonic Blaster
data.flavorText: Used to break up ink blots underwater, this sonic gun was key to helping the pirates defeat the Order of Influence's ancient beast in a war fought long ago.

data.name: Underwater Camera
data.flavorText: Can be used by wizards to take a picture underwater.

data.name: Shipwreck Gem
data.flavorText: A sapphire given to you for passing Eve's trials and defeating the monster Old One. This is one of the Warden Keystones used to gain access to the Academy.

data.name: Magi's Shroud
data.flavorText: Worn by apprentice wizards, the Magi's Shroud is a light, yet magical garb.

data.name: Warlock's Robe
data.flavorText: A robe made from magical silk, used by student and teacher alike at the Academy.

data.name: Jester's Robes
data.flavorText: The bells on this cloak only ring when its wearer wins a battle, never when they walk.

data.name: Crimson Coat
data.flavorText: It is common to see this fine colorful coat worn by fancy folk at formal gatherings. Or by pirates.

data.name: Angelic Shroud
data.flavorText: Only the most powerful wizards wear this enchanted robe, adorned with eagle's feathers.

data.name: Glacial Ward
data.flavorText: It is said the ice crystals used to make this robe will protect its wearer from bad things.

data.name: Dragon Scales
data.flavorText: Made from the hide of "Carcus the Terrible" the most unforgiving dragon ever known.

data.name: Sun's Embrace
data.flavorText: This cloak can sense its wearer and will burn more brightly when it detects fear.

data.name: Water Robe
data.flavorText: The standard robe worn by initiated members of the Academy's Water School.

data.name: Fire Robe
data.flavorText: The bright robe worn only by those who have braved Bonfire Spires many dangers.

data.name: Air Robe
data.flavorText: The standard robe worn by initiated members of the Academy's Storm School.

data.name: Earth Robe
data.flavorText: The standard robe worn by initiated members of the Academy's Earth School.

data.name: Training Garb
data.flavorText: Worn for practice dueling, it is not uncommon to see this garb singed and torn.

data.name: Light Clothes
data.flavorText: The favourite choice of wizards on hot days, it's cool but provides little protection.

data.name: Cloth Robe
data.flavorText: Light and durable, this robe is prized by wizards both young and old for its comfort.

data.name: Heavy Robe
data.flavorText: Made for wizards who don't like being cold but don't mind being itchy.

data.name: Leather Apparel
data.flavorText: For the stylish wizard, these robes are intimidating and stain-resistant!

data.name: Durofibre Robe
data.flavorText: Modern wizards love how soft these robes feel, often worn by academics in libraries.

data.name: Magi-thread Outfit
data.flavorText: The Magi were ancient wizards that studied the stars. They wore these robes for their most important ceremonies.

data.name: Pyrium Robe
data.flavorText: This is the product of genius weavers who were able to spin metal into colorful threads.

data.name: Mithril Robe
data.flavorText: As strong as it is lightweight, Mithril was once rare because it could only be found in distant lands.

data.name: Vitrium Robe
data.flavorText: This robe gets its name from its large blue gems, often referred to as "Water Glass".

data.name: Culix Robe
data.flavorText: Specially designed for a northern wizard who studied the history of magic, Culix's diaries are required reading for student wizards.

data.name: Trialmaster's Garb
data.flavorText: Only the Trial Masters of past and present were given these robes and are forbidden to take them off. How did you get them?

data.name: Anorak Suit
data.flavorText: Need to keep warm in those winter days? It may not be a robe, but it sure is warm!

data.name: Winterfest Outfit
data.flavorText: The official outfit worn by helpers at Winterfest!

data.name: Dragon Spike Robes
data.flavorText: In close combat these spikes are dangerous indeed. Be careful when you're around your friends!

data.name: Warm Robes
data.flavorText: Commonly worn in very cold places, these robes are made from many layers of fur and pelts.

data.name: Firefly Robes
data.flavorText: A magical robe made from the leaves and materials found in Firefly Forest.

data.name: Magic Robes
data.flavorText: These robes were custom made for a wizard...but they seem to fit you just right!

data.name: Frost Saber Robes
data.flavorText: These wooly robes will keep you warm in cold weather...but don't wear them in the sun!

data.name: Duelist Robes
data.flavorText: The robes of one of the greatest wizards in the Academy.

data.name: Shiverchill Robes
data.flavorText: The ceremonial robes of the Shiverchill Tribes.

data.name: Bonfire Robes
data.flavorText: These can only be worn by those who have seen the "Bonfire of the Spire", a volcanic eruption, up close.

data.name: Captain's Digs
data.flavorText: Don't these just scream "Arggg"? They even come with the optional hook attachment!

data.name: Buccaneer's Digs
data.flavorText: The choice clothes of deckhands and mates everywhere. Watch out, captains will be sure to shout orders at you.

data.name: Skywatch Gear
data.flavorText: Humans that come up to the clouds wear this outfit to stay warm and dry.

data.name: Mira's Robes
data.flavorText: These robes give off immense power, and almost seem to repel the ground below you.

data.name: Diggin' Outfit
data.flavorText: This is the outfit of the Oasis Institute of Natural Creatures (OINC).

data.name: Desert Robes
data.flavorText: These robes protect the wearer from the brutal weather in the desert.

data.name: Tinkerer Outfit
data.flavorText: This outfit is very stylish, but also pretty heavy-duty! The people back then sure were tough!

data.name: TEK-Y4 Jumpsuit
data.flavorText: The jumpsuit worn by the official TEK-Y4 dance instructors. Kind of sweaty...

data.name: Robot Outfit
data.flavorText: Whoever said that a wizard couldn't be a robot never had a chance to try these on...

data.name: Pumpkin Outfit
data.flavorText: The Pumpkin Lord is said to return every year on Pumpkinfest to rule over all pumpkins.

data.name: Luminite Costume
data.flavorText: A cute Luminite costume! It's so lifelike!

data.name: Specter Robes
data.flavorText: The tattered robes of the legendary specter - a ghost that only shows up around Pumpkinfest.

data.name: Mountaineer's Gear
data.flavorText: This warm, rugged coat is equipped with a standard set of climbing equipment, a must have for exploring the mountains.

data.name: Frost Beard's Clasp
data.flavorText: The magic armor of the great Viking Frost Beard - a mystic wind constantly billows its cape.

data.name: Yeti Coat
data.flavorText: Who knew that Yetis shed?! Whether the coat directly came from a Yeti or was crafted from loose hairs is unclear.

data.name: Red Armor
data.flavorText: This armor is lighter than it looks, but it seems to be all for show...the metal actually seems to be plastic...

data.name: Phantom Cloak
data.flavorText: A magic barrier seems to emanate from the cloak...protecting you from all sorts of nasty spells.

data.name: Draconyx Gear
data.flavorText: Worn by ancient battle wizards, this gear seems to fit you perfectly, almost as if you were meant to wear it.

data.name: Black Fang Coat
data.flavorText: This outfit is worn only by the greatest of Bounty Hunters. It is a testament to the skill of its wearer.

data.name: Hunter Coat
data.flavorText: The standard-issue garb of a Bounty Hunter. It holds up in the toughest of situations.

data.name: Bee Suit
data.flavorText: 'Fly like a bee and sting like a bee'. Wait, that's not right...

data.name: Candle Knight Armor
data.flavorText: This armor was used by Candle Knights for protection.

data.name: Dire Pirate Tunic
data.flavorText: Just the thing to wear if you are planning on fighting rodents that are quite large.

data.name: Jelly Hakama
data.flavorText: They're made from a material that mimics the magic-resistance of jellyfish. Commonly worn during festivals-at-sea.

data.name: Deep Diving Suit
data.flavorText: Keeps the water out and your gases in. You have been warned.

data.name: Sea Sword Suit
data.flavorText: The plates of the suit are flexible, so it offers protection without making it hard to move.

data.name: Admiral's Coat
data.flavorText: This old coat belonged to the admiral who led the charge against the evil Order of Influence many years ago.

data.name: Shell Body Armor
data.flavorText: No one is sure what creature used to live in this shell before it left to find a new home. But one thing's certain: it must have been tough.

data.name: Fairy Dress
data.flavorText: A classical green fairy dress.

data.name: Wood Knight Armor
data.flavorText: Don't let it fool you because it's made of wood. This is made from some of the sturdiest bark around!

data.name: Frost Knight Armor
data.flavorText: Armor forged from ice found at the top of Shiverchill Mountain.

data.name: Scarecrow Costume
data.flavorText: This costume's great for hanging out on a cool Pumpkinfest night with its loads of stuffing!

data.name: Aquascale Armor
data.flavorText: The strong power of dragons suits you.

data.name: Fernscale Armor
data.flavorText: The lightest dragon scales make this elegant armor.

data.name: Sky Captain's Coat
data.flavorText: Be the captain of all you survey with this military style coat. The brass buttons are oh so fitting.

data.name: Steampunk Gear Gown
data.flavorText: Tools and spare parts fit into the hidden pockets of this classy but practical gown.

data.name: Blue Star Jersey
data.flavorText: More than a shirt for you, this is a uniform for Team Blue!

data.name: Red Badge Jersey
data.flavorText: From your toes to your head, you gotta wear Team Red.

data.name: Sunburst Ski Outfit
data.flavorText: Get ready to 'get down' on the slopes with this sunburst ski outfit.

data.name: Ice Crystal Ski Togs
data.flavorText: The finest winter fashion can be yours with this Ice Crystal ski suit.Part of the elite Ice Crystal set.

data.name: Snowy Snowsuit
data.flavorText: Let everyone know you are up for playing in the snow with this snowy snowsuit.

data.name: Nice Holiday Box
data.flavorText: Hide under the tree or run about the streets having fun, this outfit is a present to yourself.

data.name: Fancy Holiday Present
data.flavorText: Let everyone know you are not only here, you are PRESENT!

data.name: Deluxe Gilt Gift
data.flavorText: Created by a famous 'wrapper', this outfit has bling, but is also...square? No matter, it is simply the best, and you gotta have it.

data.name: Titan Conqueror Power Armor
data.flavorText: After Titan Shards are cleaned of Shadow by Floatlings' knowledge-based magic, they become enchanted. This power armor is powered by the cleaned Shards.

data.name: Glacier Armor
data.flavorText: Protect yourself! Icy blasts just bounce off this hard shell of glacier ice.

data.name: Chef's Attire
data.flavorText: Whip up some tasty monster soup and spice up your combat skills with this special uniform.

data.name: Fire Feather Outfit
data.flavorText: Magical beads and fabrics blessed with an ancient power cover this garb from top to bottom.

data.name: Hungry Spirit Garb
data.flavorText: Older Bonfire folk will tell you that the white markings were worn by heroes from long ago to keep monsters away.

data.name: Flora Tropica Lava Lava
data.flavorText: The flowers on this outfit have special properties that keep the wearer comfortable in even the hottest weather.

data.name: Peeko
data.flavorText: Peekos cheerfully wiggle their ears when they are happy, which they almost always are!

data.name: Rack-rack
data.flavorText: Not quite a cat, and not quite a raccoon, a Rack-rack is a strange but adorable mix of both.

data.name: Flyger
data.flavorText: A rare sight in air or on land, Flygers tend to hide most of the day, emerging only to dance.

data.name: Soral
data.flavorText: Soral babies love attention, often squawking loudly when people stop paying attention to them.

data.name: Solarix
data.flavorText: The sun's rays reflect off of the Solarix in all directions, making it appear to glow yellow.

data.name: Solarasis
data.flavorText: It's rare to find more than one Solarasis at a time, and so few people know the plural form of Solarasis. Solarases? Solarasises? It's a mystery.

data.name: Dragic
data.flavorText: Scalier than other babies, the Dragic hide their mischief behind their giant smiles.

data.name: Dragling
data.flavorText: Most people are afraid of dragons, but not of Draglings. These little guys are very friendly!

data.name: Tarragon
data.flavorText: Tarragons strike fear to any opponent, but are just as playful as Dragics once you get to know them.

data.name: Creela
data.flavorText: Creela babies are very sweet by nature, and are living proof that bugs can be adorable.

data.name: Celesteate
data.flavorText: It is hard to find a Celesteate unless you look underground... they hide in nests in small groups.

data.name: Aureate
data.flavorText: The Aureate's glowing body can light up like a lightbulb bright as the sun to blind its foes.

data.name: Browl
data.flavorText: The Browl is a smart creature, capable of long division with no remainders.

data.name: Acromi
data.flavorText: The eyes of an Acromi are so big and bright, they are often mistaken for stars in the night.

data.name: Nebluff
data.flavorText: These critters are commonly seen flitting in and out of the clouds, chasing thunder and lightning.

data.name: Battaram
data.flavorText: Battarams use their large horns to make loud noises, not unlike the beat of a drum, to make music.

data.name: Battabash
data.flavorText: The horns on a Battabash's head are so heavy that they cannot walk on ice of any thickness, for fear of it cracking.

data.name: Squawks
data.flavorText: It's tough being a bird with no legs or body, but Squawks never complain... or get tired!

data.name: Tribeak
data.flavorText: It's harder to take down three birds with one stone.

data.name: Luminite
data.flavorText: A Luminite is very loyal and friendly, earning it the nickname 'Man's Bestest Friend.'

data.name: Lumiot
data.flavorText: A bigger Luminite, the Lumiot is much better at playing fetch, catch, and napping in the sun.

data.name: Luminex
data.flavorText: Lumiots that do not brush or clean their fur for long periods of time turn into Luminexes.

data.name: Tinyger
data.flavorText: Tinygers only walk upright to impress others, and even wear pants to appear more human.

data.name: Tyscout
data.flavorText: Tyscouts are Tinygers that have learned to live and work with humans, and have even been seen taking jobs.

data.name: Flikflit
data.flavorText: Don't let the size of Flikflit fool you... they are lightning-fast and almost impossible to catch.

data.name: Serrazag
data.flavorText: The female Serrazag freezes the air around her to create ice tunnels to protect her from danger.

data.name: Sprite
data.flavorText: Sprites are tiny insects, capable of producing melodies through their flute-like mouths.

data.name: Serrazig
data.flavorText: The male Serrazig uses his thick tail to steer himself through the sky, much like a rudder on a boat.

data.name: Pomprikle
data.flavorText: The quills on the Pomprikle's body react to stress, and can be very dangerous when scared or excited.

data.name: Spindle
data.flavorText: Spindles have strong arms, and often collect small junk to throw at their enemies if bothered.

data.name: Muckster
data.flavorText: Mucksters are very friendly, and will always water your plants when you are away from home.

data.name: Sprike
data.flavorText: Sprikes are very antisocial creatures, and tend to spend most of their time avoiding everything.

data.name: Aquaster
data.flavorText: The Aquaster's tail holds the water used for its spells and feels like a full water balloon.

data.name: Hotpot
data.flavorText: Hotpots are not actually stoves, but actually monsters hiding inside discarded stoves.

data.name: Mystyyk
data.flavorText: The mythical Mystyyk is hard to tame, as it has difficulty trusting new people.

data.name: Mystile
data.flavorText: Mystiles are very shy. But if one is lucky,  they can be glimpsed prancing and dancing in remote corners of Firefly Forest.

data.name: Mystember
data.flavorText: Students often recall seeing this dark horse in their dreams, which gives it its name.

data.name: Emburn
data.flavorText: An Emburn's tail flickers like a candle, and is easily seen in the dark of night.

data.name: Liosen
data.flavorText: Liosen is Prince of the Forest, but is only considered King when it wears a Forest Emerald.

data.name: Snoots
data.flavorText: A Snoots is hard to impress...ite always claims to know everything before it was cool.

data.name: Highfawn
data.flavorText: The Highfawn prides itself on its razor-sharp talons, giant wingspan, and tremendous modesty.

data.name: Gloricious
data.flavorText: Known as the King of Peaks, the Gloricious banished the Highfawn to the forest for not using a coaster.

data.name: Evolotus
data.flavorText: Due to their hybrid nature, Evolotuses look like flowers, sting like bees, and soar like Browls.

data.name: Prodraxis
data.flavorText: It's rumored that the Prodraxis was an abandoned Ice Dragon baby that was raised by a pack of Snoots.

data.name: Flameger
data.flavorText: On the warmest summer days, Flamegers can be seen playing in the morning sun, glowing brightly.

data.name: Gnawdy
data.flavorText: Unlike sharks, Gnawdys can leave water for short periods of time, hunting prey in and out of water.

data.name: Crookfang
data.flavorText: The jaws of a Crookfang are so sharp that they can cut steel, and most researchers avoid them completely.

data.name: Ashlet
data.flavorText: The feathers of an Ashlet are said to bring good luck, but unfortunately are too hot to touch.

data.name: Smoldash
data.flavorText: The temperatures given off by the wings of a Smoldash are hot enough to boil water, and have even been known to melt some metals.

data.name: Arcticlaw
data.flavorText: Arcticlaws are one of the most loyal and protective pets. If you can befriend one, that is.

data.name: Frostfang
data.flavorText: Frostfangs are so in touch with the cold that they can dance between falling snowflakes just for the fun of it.

data.name: Saplette
data.flavorText: Since Saplettes don't move around much, they develop strange personalities and senses of humor.

data.name: Arboreal
data.flavorText: Arboreals grow much quicker than trees in the forest. They're also known to trip students in the forest with their long roots, just for fun.

data.name: Vinequeen
data.flavorText: As they cannot move fast, Vinequeens rely on their wits to convince others to do their bidding.

data.name: Truckle
data.flavorText: Most people do not consider Truckles to be worthy opponents, but if you corner one, it will do anything to get past you.

data.name: Cloud Nibbler
data.flavorText: Due to their size and shape, Cloud Nibblers are often mistaken for balloons, floating among the clouds.

data.name: Cloud Gobbler
data.flavorText: Cloud Gobblers live off the moisture in the clouds, flying around with their mouth open, chomping on the open air.

data.name: Ivory Truckle
data.flavorText: The Ivory Truckle is a rare sight in the forest... usually found only by the most skilled trackers.

data.name: TripTrop
data.flavorText: The sound of music in the forest usually indicates a Triptrop is nearby. They are nimble creatures, and love a good challenge.

data.name: ClipClop
data.flavorText: Unlike TripTrops, the music of a ClipClop is unpleasant, and most wizards cannot stand to listen to it for too long.

data.name: Dreamlet
data.flavorText: Dreamlets are small, intelligent and wiry critters, and are considered rarer than diamonds.

data.name: Ivory TripTrop
data.flavorText: In rare cases, a TripTrop is born with white fur instead of grey. These creatures are considered good luck in the forest.

data.name: Flame Neek
data.flavorText: A Flame Neek is born from small flames, such as flickering candles or dying campfires in the forest.

data.name: Flame Caller
data.flavorText: Flame Callers have mouths but choose not to speak - instead concocting their own language in flame.

data.name: Flame Creator
data.flavorText: The staff of a Flame Creator is very ordinary, but the fire magic produced from it is legendary.

data.name: River Neek
data.flavorText: A newborn River Neek will hide in the shallows of ponds and rivers, blowing bubbles and teasing small fish.

data.name: River Caller
data.flavorText: The bottoms of large lakes are commonly filled with River Callers, who hold parties from time to time with the fish.

data.name: River Creator
data.flavorText: River Creators grow attached to small bodies of water, and will replenish them in times of drought.

data.name: Forest Neek
data.flavorText: Once born, a Forest Neek hides in the leaves of the trees, dropping acorns on the heads of passing wizards below.

data.name: Forest Caller
data.flavorText: Large gusts of wind may signify the presence of Forest Callers, which have the ability to 'ride' the winds.

data.name: Forest Creator
data.flavorText: Forest Creators are not particularly smart and have terrible memories - but are kindhearted and use their magic to help others.

data.name: Cloud Neek
data.flavorText: Born from the clouds on warm days, the Cloud Neek will hide in bushes and create small winds, blowing off wizards' hats.

data.name: Cloud Caller
data.flavorText: Cloud Callers grow tired of the forests and plains quickly, and ascend to the clouds at an early age.

data.name: Cloud Creator
data.flavorText: When bored, Cloud Creators will often create thunderstorms on clear days, just to hear the thunder boom.

data.name: Puck
data.flavorText: These small imps are known to imitate different animal sounds, throwing hunters off their trails.

data.name: Flaria
data.flavorText: Flarias can turn into flames at any time, but only do so when they get hungry.

data.name: Rascal
data.flavorText: Snowy summer days means a Rascal is close, likely stealing the numbers off of people's houses.

data.name: Shardic
data.flavorText: Shardics are known for hiding in many cold places, and have even been found in freezers.

data.name: Keeper
data.flavorText: People often mistake Keepers for granite gargoyles, as they often sit motionless for days.

data.name: Scally
data.flavorText: All Scallies are slow and always sleepy, but can move fast when it's time to eat.

data.name: Fissural
data.flavorText: Fissurals are picky eaters, and will only eat vegetables that are organically grown.

data.name: Sentinel
data.flavorText: People often mistake Sentinels for stone gargoyles, as they often sit motionless for days.

data.name: Hob
data.flavorText: Hobs are very mischievous creatures, and have the odd habit of moving around furniture.

data.name: Wick
data.flavorText: Wicks cannot fly, but instead spend their time building artificial wings and flying machines.

data.name: Nebulite
data.flavorText: People often mistake Nebulites for marble gargoyles, as they often sit motionless for days.

data.name: Squally
data.flavorText: Snowmen made by students can become enchanted and turn into Squallies.

data.name: Tempest
data.flavorText: Tempests love to play tricks, hiding as snowmen and taking students' hats.

data.name: Flurrious
data.flavorText: Though they look mean, Flurrious are known for leading lost students down the mountain.

data.name: Cloaker
data.flavorText: Cloakers are ghosts known to wear old clothing they find lying about, and grow attached to these rags.

data.name: Arbite
data.flavorText: Contrary to popular belief, Arbites cannot fly through walls - and in fact are quite clumsy in the dark.

data.name: Shade
data.flavorText: Sometimes, a Cloaker chooses a cloak and bonds with it, making the Cloaker more powerful and becoming a Shade instead.

data.name: Spectral
data.flavorText: Spectrals can often be seen flying at midnight, attracted to the moon like moths to a lightbulb.

data.name: Burnewt
data.flavorText: Though slow-moving, the Burnewt can emit bursts of steam to ward off attackers, like a boiling teapot.

data.name: Singenewt
data.flavorText: Over time, a Burnewt's body becomes hotter and hotter, changing it into a Singenewt.

data.name: Infernewt
data.flavorText: Infernewts are often mistaken for baby dragons in the mountains - but cannot fly, roar or breathe fire.

data.name: Embershed
data.flavorText: Embersheds are rare in the mountains, as they spend most of their lives in caves, reading and perfecting many languages.

data.name: Mimic
data.flavorText: Look out! Not all treasure chests are full of treasure... sometimes, a Mimic is hiding inside instead!

data.name: Funkeel
data.flavorText: This tiny serpent gives off a distinct glow as it moves underwater, tricking predators into believing it is a piece of metal.

data.name: Beneel
data.flavorText: Funkeels grow quickly into Beneels, which swim to the depths of the ocean in order to grow larger and larger.

data.name: Fathom
data.flavorText: Fathoms are the largest known monster at the Academy. They rarely surface from the ocean depths, returning only to watch passing ships.

data.name: Squibble
data.flavorText: The gem on a Squibble's head is known to be good luck, and is often the target of fishermen.

data.name: Squabble
data.flavorText: Squabbles, unlike Squibbles, are known to challenge other Squabbles over territory and favorite sports teams.

data.name: Squarrel
data.flavorText: A Squarrel spends Sundays squabbling with Squibbles and Saturdays skulking with Squabbles.

data.name: Trampel
data.flavorText: Trampels are rumored to be extremely clumsy, tripping over their feet like puppies.

data.name: Stampeed
data.flavorText: A herd of Stampeeds is supposed to be so loud that you could hear it from over 5 miles away.

data.name: Pokkit
data.flavorText: Pokkits are considered slow-moving and skittish, spending most of their time hiding in their shells.

data.name: Claustro
data.flavorText: Unlike Pokkits, Claustros are thought to be aggressive, and will chase away trespassers for hours.

data.name: Pterrotell
data.flavorText: Millions of years ago the skies would be full of Pterrotells, in large flocks of up to 100.

data.name: Pterrocks
data.flavorText: A single flock of Pterrotells is said to have been led by a single Pterroks, who would hang back and shout orders.

data.name: Terromite
data.flavorText: Terromites left massive footprints behind, causing scientists to believe they were much larger than in reality.

data.name: Terrosaur
data.flavorText: Terrosaur has many nicknames, including 'King Dyno', 'Sharp Teeth' and 'Big Poppa T'.

data.name: Cogmite
data.flavorText: Cogmites are known to gather around large sources of electricity, at which point they all fall asleep. Academy experts call this phenomenon a 'slumber party'.

data.name: Gearsite
data.flavorText: A Gearsite can move its eyes in any direction, and can see for great distances. It is easily the most paranoid monster on the island.

data.name: Bitbot
data.flavorText: The tiny Bitbot is very social, and tends to stay in large groups to protect itself from predators.

data.name: Bashbot
data.flavorText: Bashbots are ill-tempered, and easily annoyed. In fact, it is said that Bashbots rarely get along with one another as they are always arguing.

data.name: Batterbot
data.flavorText: The massive Batterbot may be strong, but he is very slow and lazy. Most Batterbots wait around for something interesting to happen, and sleep the day away.

data.name: Fishbol
data.flavorText: The water inside the head of a Fishbol is used to cool its machinery, which can reach scalding temperatures.

data.name: Aquariot
data.flavorText: Aquariots are avid collectors, and it is not uncommon to see items floating around the water in their heads...including small fish!

data.name: Aracute
data.flavorText: Aracutes prefer warm, dry places to live, and are often found living in the walls of old buildings. They emerge only to look for food and new housing, which is actually quite frequently.

data.name: Arachex
data.flavorText: Arachex are notoriously fast runners, but only for short distances. In fact, an arachex will only ever run for a maximum of 99.87542 meters before stopping. This makes it difficult to compete in track competitions.

data.name: Ice Neek
data.flavorText: An Ice Neek is commonly found in places with low temperatures, but also has a strange curiosity towards fire.

data.name: Ice Caller
data.flavorText: Whenever a snowstorm is present, you can bet an Ice Caller is somewhere in the midst of it. It's rumored that they use these storms as a form of showering.

data.name: Ice Creator
data.flavorText: An Ice Creator is a rare sight, found only in the coldest, deepest dungeons. They are fiercely territorial, often claiming entire dungeons for themselves.

data.name: Big Hex
data.flavorText: Big Hex can create almost any type of machinery from raw scraps, and can even power them using his own energy. Thanks to his creation, Big Hex can use magic to harness storm power and create powerful spells.

data.name: Florafox
data.flavorText: Florafox can speak with nearby plants and trees by planting itself in the soil. The bulb on Florafoxs tail produces a pollen that can heal any plant, no matter how injured or withered.

data.name: Arctursus
data.flavorText: The air around Arctursus is always cold. This is because the tips of his fur are made from an ice that can never melt, and so no matter where he goes he is always at a comfortable temperature.

data.name: Diveodile
data.flavorText: Diveodile's natural magic ability is boosted by the Warden pendant it wears, allowing it to cast strong water spells to generate water, or even control the water around itself!

data.name: Magmischief
data.flavorText: While traveling underground, Magmischief can sense movement on the surface, so he knows exactly where to appear and get the biggest scare out of those who have entered Bonfire Spire.

data.name: Chill & Char
data.flavorText: Chill & Char are best friends, not just because they share a body, but because their abilities complement each other so well.

data.name: Tidus
data.flavorText: Deep in the sea, Tidus can flap his powerful wings to create massive waves. Sometimes he rides them to shore, but only if no one is looking.

data.name: Luma
data.flavorText: On sunny days, Luma loves to romp through flower-filled fields, soaking up the sun rays.

data.name: Eclipse
data.flavorText: Eclipse soars and swoops through the clouds in the night sky, playing hide and go seek with the moon and stars.

data.name: Skin Tone 1
data.flavorText: Buying this will change your skin tone!

data.name: Skin Tone 2
data.flavorText: Buying this will change your skin tone!

data.name: Skin Tone 3
data.flavorText: Buying this will change your skin tone!

data.name: Skin Tone 4
data.flavorText: Buying this will change your skin tone!

data.name: Skin Tone 5
data.flavorText: Buying this will change your skin tone!

data.name: Enchanted Stick
data.flavorText: The most unassuming of wands, it is said to be imbued with natural energy.

data.name: Ivory Star
data.flavorText: Just like the stars themselves, it is most powerful under the cover of night.

data.name: Angelic Shard
data.flavorText: Charmed with a celestial power, wizards take it to be a symbol of justice and good.

data.name: Blue Pearl
data.flavorText: Its orb pulsates when close to the ocean and water pets hum gently in its presence.

data.name: Cheeple's Toy Wand
data.flavorText: Often given to young wizards who love that it squawks when it casts a spell.

data.name: Dragonwing
data.flavorText: Hold on tight! Many unsuspecting wizards have watched this wand fly away.

data.name: Lunar Staff
data.flavorText: Made for a wizard who was also a werewolf, it strengthens as the moon approaches full.

data.name: Wanderer's Staff
data.flavorText: Friend to the wizard who travels far from home, it comforts a lonely heart and smells of fresh bread.

data.name: Firewing
data.flavorText: It was once a wizard's pet Phoenix that relinquished its magic to empower his wand. It saved him from peril most great.

data.name: Dragon's Bane
data.flavorText: The wand used to end the reign of "Carcus the Terrible", its origins are a mystery.

data.name: Hurricane
data.flavorText: To save her village, a wizard once ran into the eye of a storm. When it abated, all that remained was this wand.

data.name: Firebrand
data.flavorText: The wand that belonged to Crios as a child, he cast it aside as "weak" when he entered the Academy.

data.name: Frozen Shard
data.flavorText: Cold to the touch, wizards who use it shiver uncontrollably and their lips turn blue.

data.name: Wand of Dreams
data.flavorText: Whoever possesses this wand will never have a dreamless sleep and when they dream of the future, it always comes true.

data.name: Nature's Bloom
data.flavorText: During the winter its leaf withers and falls off but always grows again the following spring.

data.name: Angel Wing
data.flavorText: This staff was once paired with another just like it and belonged to twin wizards.

data.name: Vita
data.flavorText: Energizing whoever holds it, this staff was forged entirely from the earth by ancient wizards using a method now lost.

data.name: Staff of Flames
data.flavorText: Commonly used by the Flameweavers of the Spire to create beautiful burning patterns in the night sky.

data.name: Tidal Sphere
data.flavorText: Long sought after by pirates who can use it to push their ships through the waves.

data.name: Frosted Spear
data.flavorText: Its central gem comes from deep in the Shiverchill Mountains, allowing wizards to turn the water in air to ice.

data.name: Dragon Staff
data.flavorText: Used by the Dragon Tamers of old, no one knows if it retains its power to control the winged beasts. Do you dare find out?

data.name: Phoenix Talon
data.flavorText: Containing the power of the Phoenix, some say the one who holds it can recover from any injury.

data.name: Dream
data.flavorText: Made by a Dreamweaver, if used correctly, it can put your opponent into a deep sleep.

data.name: Efflorescence
data.flavorText: Its wielder need have no fear of the dark. The power of the forest makes everything visible.

data.name: Training Wand
data.flavorText: Also known as the "Safety Wand", it is used by all academy wizards to reduce injury during training.

data.name: Birch Wand
data.flavorText: A creative wizard carved this himself from a branch in a nearby forest.

data.name: Granite Wand
data.flavorText: A geologist wizard once claimed that a wand could be made from rocks, this wand proves it!

data.name: Iron Wand
data.flavorText: Though rough to the touch and very heavy, its got plenty of power for the everyday wizard.

data.name: Steel Wand
data.flavorText: Forged from various metals by blacksmiths, some wizards feel that its the best material for wands.

data.name: Onyx Wand
data.flavorText: Its dark stone sparkles, making it look like stars in the night sky.

data.name: Diamond Wand
data.flavorText: The diamond in this wand has not been shaped or cut, leaving its earthly energy untouched.

data.name: Pyrium Wand
data.flavorText: Though it looks like gold, it's not. Pyrium is prized for its strength and flexibility, making this a very durable wand.

data.name: Mithril Wand
data.flavorText: Not as rare as it once was, Mithril is still popular amongst the wizards of distant lands.

data.name: Magite Wand
data.flavorText: Students of the stars, the Magi loved the setting sun most of all, making this their favorite wand.

data.name: Adamantium Wand
data.flavorText: Its strength iswith shimmering minerals which ma unsurpassed by any other metal wand, it has been known to block even the most potent of spells.

data.name: Training Staff
data.flavorText: Some say that staffs are more powerful but are also harder to use, making this staff very important for training.

data.name: Birch Staff
data.flavorText: In the old days wizards would carve their own staffs from the wood of the forest, this one seems quite old.

data.name: Granite Staff
data.flavorText: Only the strongest wizards can carry the weight of this staff, giving it the nickname the "Staff of Giants".

data.name: Iron Staff
data.flavorText: Used by the monks of the ancient lands, many have adopted its use because of its common materials and uncommon strength.

data.name: Steel Staff
data.flavorText: The choice of wizard knights of old, who could carry the lightweight staff with all their heavy armor on.

data.name: Onyx Staff
data.flavorText: It's smooth and polished to shine. It's clear a fine craftsman made this beautiful staff.

data.name: Diamond Staff
data.flavorText: Diamond is very hard and very sharp, it's recommended that you wear gloves when using this staff.

data.name: Pyrium Staff
data.flavorText: Pyrium is difficult to work with. It must have taken a great blacksmith to make this staff.

data.name: Mithril Staff
data.flavorText: This staff has an aura of old power around it. Did it come from somewhere far away?

data.name: Magite Staff
data.flavorText: The Magi liked staffs over wands because they were longer and they reached closer to the stars.

data.name: Adamantium Staff
data.flavorText: Made from the strongest of metals, its beauty is only matched by its power.

data.name: The Master of Trials
data.flavorText: To be held only by the Trial Masters, its powers are the stuff of legends. How did you get it?

data.name: Winter Bell
data.flavorText: Its sound is beautiful, but don't be lulled by its enchanting tones.

data.name: Minotaur's Head
data.flavorText: A prize given to those who have successfully navigated the Labyrinth, it prevents them from ever being lost again.

data.name: Sunburst Wand
data.flavorText: A ball of energy from the sun itself.

data.name: Flamerose Wand
data.flavorText: Designed to appear like the mythical Flamerose, a rare flower that grows only on the side of the Bonfire Spire.

data.name: Crystal Wand
data.flavorText: Transparent, it's easy to admire the beauty of the energy being charged inside this wand just before a spell is cast.

data.name: Batwing Wand
data.flavorText: Those who hold this wand can sense what is around them even in the darkest of caves - much like the bat, which gives the wand its name.

data.name: Fungoid
data.flavorText: Many wizards refuse to make their wands from living trees, instead they grow this wand from the forest's soils.

data.name: Sacred Flame
data.flavorText: For those who hail from the Spire, this wand that carries a flame from Bonfire is respected and admired.

data.name: Sun Orb Staff
data.flavorText: Its heat is so immense that its owner must possess great knowledge of fire magic simply to be in its presence.

data.name: Staff of Winter
data.flavorText: In the hands of the ice king of old, this staff was used to turn those who insulted his beard into frozen statues.

data.name: Crystal Staff
data.flavorText: As beautiful as it is elegant, it can be used to break light into parts that can be weaved into powerful spells.

data.name: TuskTooth
data.flavorText: An ancient staff from the realms of the Shiverchill tribes, it is thought to possess an animal spirit.

data.name: Dragos
data.flavorText: Also known as the "Heart of the Dragon", the limits of this staff's power have never been reached.

data.name: Twisted Staff
data.flavorText: This staff was grown by tree whisperers from the roots of the elder trees deep in the heart of the Firefly Forest.

data.name: Staff of the Duelist
data.flavorText: Crios once swore that if anyone could beat him in a duel, he'd give them this staff. Looks like you did it!

data.name: Hailstone
data.flavorText: The central stone for this staff can only be gathered during storms on the coldest winter nights by the Shiverchill Tribes.

data.name: Burning Brand of Bonfire
data.flavorText: Forged in the heat of the Bonfire Spire, it inspires both fear and awe in anyone who opposes it.

data.name: Toy Parrot
data.flavorText: This was a favorite wand among pirate children!

data.name: Turtle Topper
data.flavorText: The stoic turtle figure on this wand was made to honor a wise old tortoise.

data.name: Remote Ship
data.flavorText: This little remote may look normal, but something is awful strange about it. Maybe because it doesn't need batteries...

data.name: Mira's Staff
data.flavorText: A gift from the great wizard Mira. Just holding this staff makes you feel stronger than ever before.

data.name: Wrench
data.flavorText: Not a very powerful weapon, but certainly useful for tightening bolts!

data.name: Gizmotron
data.flavorText: A modified machine, the gizmotron stores magic inside and releases it at the user's will.

data.name: Pumpkin Wand
data.flavorText: A plastic wand replica of the original Pumpkin Lord's weapon of choice...

data.name: Spooky Candle
data.flavorText: There's nothing really wrong with this candle, but it does kind of give you the creeps.

data.name: Mjoln-Ice
data.flavorText: A mystic hammer wielded by the great Frost Beard - some say the hammer grants its wielder the powers of a Norse god.

data.name: Pickaxe
data.flavorText: A standard-issue pickaxe, popular among the miners who used to inhabit the Shiverchill mines.

data.name: Energy Staff
data.flavorText: This staff likely used to be much more powerful...when it worked. Now, it just seems to be used to intimidate.

data.name: Glassfire
data.flavorText: This strange orb seems to have a small elemental stuck inside, though it seems happy enough in there.

data.name: Draconyx
data.flavorText: There's something about this staff that you don't like - as if strange whispers beckon you to hold it and never let go.

data.name: Power Orb
data.flavorText: This weapon is wielded only by the greatest of Bounty Hunters. Nearby monsters are drawn to its crystalline orb with a hypnotic pull.

data.name: Clawed Staff
data.flavorText: The standard-issue weapon of a Bounty Hunter. Its claw is perfect for catching rogue monsters.

data.name: Casting Candle
data.flavorText: This is the primary tool used by the Candle Knights. Like the helmet, the light on this candle can never be extinguished.

data.name: Big Hex Conductor
data.flavorText: This was made by Big Hex himself!

data.name: Arctursus Power Rod
data.flavorText: This rod was forged by the Warden that gave Arctursus his frost gauntlets.

data.name: Florafox Wand
data.flavorText: This wand was grown in the same garden as Florafox. It is said to hold the same plant-healing magic that Florafox can create.

data.name: Diveodile Sea Staff
data.flavorText: This staff was crafted by townsfolk that lived on the eastern shore of the island, in the hopes that it would help them protect their waters as Diveodile did.

data.name: Magmischief Fire Rod
data.flavorText: The rod was fashioned out of a stalagmite made of magma in a deep, hidden cave in Bonfire Spire.

data.name: Crystal staff
data.flavorText: A staff made of crystal!

data.name: Fairy Sword
data.flavorText: This magical blade was created by fairies for other creatures who defend their forest.

data.name: Veggie Rod
data.flavorText: A wacky old wizard thought that vegetables had some hidden magical power, and so they created this staff. Maybe they were right?

data.name: Umbrella
data.flavorText: Whack enemies and protect yourself from rain!

data.name: Wingblade
data.flavorText: Legend says these swords belonged to the Sky Knights who fought on the backs of Pegasi a long time ago.

data.name: Jellyfish Wand
data.flavorText: Designed to harness magical spells by using the shape of a jellyfish as a focal point.

data.name: Montoya's Blade
data.flavorText: It was once said that this blade was made for an evil man who had more than 5 fingers!

data.name: Caster Clam
data.flavorText: Not the most powerful wand out there, but people who live under the sea love it for its style.

data.name: Spiral Shell Spellcaster
data.flavorText: This ancient wand had been lost in the ocean many years ago after a battle with the Order of Influence.

data.name: Butterfly Wand
data.flavorText: A magical wand created by the Fairies of Firefly Forest.

data.name: Vorpald  Blade
data.flavorText: These swords appeared in Firefly Forest, allegedly from another dimension!

data.name: Frost Blade
data.flavorText: Forged in the sheer cold of a Shiverchill night on the mountainside. These were the magic-casters of choice for many who lived around the mountain.

data.name: Smoky Spatula
data.flavorText: It casts magic, and can flip burgers. What more could you want?

data.name: Candy Corn Wand
data.flavorText: At the very tip of the wand is where the magic is strongest.

data.name: Chill Char Gladius
data.flavorText: A double-edged spell-sword that blends Chill & Char's opposing elements.

data.name: Tidus Blade of Waves
data.flavorText: Feel the fury of the depths with each swing of this heroic weapon.

data.name: Fiery Dragon Baton
data.flavorText: A small dragon curls around this baton, lending his power to every spell you cast.

data.name: Flame Stick of Dragonfire
data.flavorText: Flames shoot from your hand as you cast spell after spell with this sick Stick of Dragonfire!

data.name: Perching Fire Dragon Lance
data.flavorText: Wield the full fury of dragonfire with this lance of elemental power.

data.name: Luma Sun Ray Rod
data.flavorText: Harness the sun fire of Luma with this shining bladed wand of power.

data.name: Eclipse Sky Scythe
data.flavorText: The curve of the moon against the darkness of space are captured in this impressive battle weapon.

data.name: Hockey Stick
data.flavorText: Do you feel pucky? Well...DO YA??? That might be a sticky question, but here is the sticky answer.

data.name: Titan Conqueror Power Katana
data.flavorText: Forged from repurposed Titan Shards. Concentrated Astral magic from the Shards focuses spells that emit from this sword into powerful energy blasts.
